org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.admin..description: Execute DRS for a cluster. If there is another plan in progress for the same cluster, this command will fail.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of cluster

parameters.name: migrateto
parameters.description: Virtual Machine to destination host mapping. This parameter specifies the mapping between a vm and a host to migrate that VM. clusterid is required if this parameter is set.Format of this parameter: migrateto[vm-index].vm=<uuid>&migrateto[vm-index].host=<uuid> Where, [vm-index] indicates the index to identify the vm that you want to migrate, vm=<uuid> indicates the UUID of the vm that you want to migrate, and host=<uuid> indicates the UUID of the host where you want to migrate the vm. Example: migrateto[0].vm=<71f43cd6-69b0-4d3b-9fbc-67f50963d60b>&migrateto[0].host=<a382f181-3d2b-4413-b92d-b8931befa7e1>&migrateto[1].vm=<88de0173-55c0-4c1c-a269-83d0279eeedf>&migrateto[1].host=<95d6e97c-6766-4d67-9a30-c449c15011d1>&migrateto[2].vm=<1b331390-59f2-4796-9993-bf11c6e76225>&migrateto[2].host=<41fdb564-9d3b-447d-88ed-7628f7640cbc>

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.admin..description: Registers an existing ISO into the CloudStack Cloud.

parameters.name: bootable
parameters.description: true if this ISO is bootable. If not passed explicitly its assumed to be true

parameters.name: displaytext
parameters.description: the display text of the ISO, defaults to the 'name'

parameters.name: isfeatured
parameters.description: true if you want this ISO to be featured

parameters.name: ispublic
parameters.description: true if you want to register the ISO to be publicly available to all users, false otherwise.

parameters.name: isextractable
parameters.description: true if the ISO or its derivatives are extractable; default is false

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the ISO

parameters.name: ostypeid
parameters.description: the ID of the OS type that best represents the OS of this ISO. If the ISO is bootable this parameter needs to be passed

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: the URL to where the ISO is currently being hosted

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: the ID of the zone you wish to register the ISO to.

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: an optional domainId. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: an optional account name. Must be used with domainId.

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description:
the checksum value of this ISO. The parameter containing the checksum will be considered a MD5sum if it is not prefixed
 and just a plain ascii/utf8 representation of a hexadecimal string. If it is required to
 use another algorithm the hexadecimal string is to be prefixed with a string of the form,
 "{<algorithm>}", not including the double quotes. In this <algorithm> is the exact string
 representing the java supported algorithm, i.e. MD5 or SHA-256. Note that java does not
 contain an algorithm called SHA256 or one called sha-256, only SHA-256.

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: Register ISO for the project

parameters.name: imagestoreuuid
parameters.description: Image store UUID

parameters.name: isdynamicallyscalable
parameters.description: true if ISO contains XS/VMWare tools inorder to support dynamic scaling of VM CPU/memory

parameters.name: directdownload
parameters.description: true if ISO should bypass Secondary Storage and be downloaded to Primary Storage on deployment

parameters.name: passwordenabled
parameters.description: true if password reset feature is supported; default is false

parameters.name: arch
parameters.description: the CPU arch of the ISO. Valid options are: x86_64, aarch64

parameters.description: possible values are "featured", "self", "selfexecutable","sharedexecutable","executable", and "community". * featured : templates that have been marked as featured and public. * self : templates that have been registered or created by the calling user. * selfexecutable : same as self, but only returns templates that can be used to deploy a new VM. * sharedexecutable : templates ready to be deployed that have been granted to the calling user by another user. * executable : templates that are owned by the calling user, or public templates, that can be used to deploy a VM. * community : templates that have been marked as public but not featured. * all : all templates (only usable by admins).

parameters.name: vlan
parameters.description: the ID or VID of the network

parameters.name: bypassvlanoverlapcheck
parameters.description: when true bypasses VLAN id/range overlap check during network creation for shared and L2 networks

parameters.name: hideipaddressusage
parameters.description: when true ip address usage for the network will not be exported by the listUsageRecords API

parameters.name: routerip
parameters.description: IPV4 address to be assigned to a router in a shared network

parameters.name: routeripv6
parameters.description: IPV6 address to be assigned to a router in a shared network

parameters.name: bgppeerids
parameters.description: Ids of the Bgp Peer for the network

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the network

parameters.name: displaytext
parameters.description: the display text of the network

parameters.name: networkofferingid
parameters.description: the network offering ID

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: the zone ID for the network

parameters.name: physicalnetworkid
parameters.description: the physical network ID the network belongs to

parameters.name: gateway
parameters.description: the gateway of the network. Required for shared networks and isolated networks when it belongs to VPC

parameters.name: netmask
parameters.description: the netmask of the network. Required for shared networks and isolated networks when it belongs to VPC

parameters.name: startip
parameters.description: the beginning IP address in the network IP range

parameters.name: endip
parameters.description: the ending IP address in the network IP range. If not specified, will be defaulted to startIP

parameters.name: isolatedpvlan
parameters.description: the isolated private VLAN for this network

parameters.name: isolatedpvlantype
parameters.description: the isolated private VLAN type for this network

parameters.name: networkdomain
parameters.description: network domain

parameters.name: acltype
parameters.description: Access control type; supported values are account and domain. In 3.0 all shared networks should have aclType=Domain, and all isolated networks - Account. Account means that only the account owner can use the network, domain - all accounts in the domain can use the network

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: Account that will own the network. Account should be under the selected domain

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: an optional project for the network

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: domain ID of the account owning a network. If the account is not specified, but the acltype is Account or not specified, the network will be automatically assigned to the caller account and domain. To create a network under the domain without linking it to any account, make sure to include acltype=Domain parameter in the api call. If account is not specified, but acltype is Domain, the network will be created for the specified domain.

parameters.name: subdomainaccess
parameters.description: Defines whether to allow subdomains to use networks dedicated to their parent domain(s). Should be used with aclType=Domain, defaulted to allow.subdomain.network.access global config if not specified

parameters.name: vpcid
parameters.description: the VPC network belongs to

parameters.name: tungstenvirtualrouteruuid
parameters.description: Tungsten-Fabric virtual router the network belongs to

parameters.name: startipv6
parameters.description: the beginning IPv6 address in the IPv6 network range

parameters.name: endipv6
parameters.description: the ending IPv6 address in the IPv6 network range

parameters.name: ip6gateway
parameters.description: the gateway of the IPv6 network. Required for Shared networks

parameters.name: ip6cidr
parameters.description: the CIDR of IPv6 network, must be at least /64

parameters.name: externalid
parameters.description: ID of the network in an external system.

parameters.name: displaynetwork
parameters.description: an optional field, whether to the display the network to the end user or not.

parameters.name: aclid
parameters.description: Network ACL ID associated for the network

parameters.name: associatednetworkid
parameters.description: The network this network is associated to. only available if create a Shared network

parameters.name: publicmtu
parameters.description: MTU to be configured on the network VR's public facing interfaces

parameters.name: privatemtu
parameters.description: MTU to be configured on the network VR's private interface(s)

parameters.name: dns1
parameters.description: the first IPv4 DNS for the network

parameters.name: dns2
parameters.description: the second IPv4 DNS for the network

parameters.name: ip6dns1
parameters.description: the first IPv6 DNS for the network

parameters.name: ip6dns2
parameters.description: the second IPv6 DNS for the network

parameters.name: sourcenatipaddress
parameters.description:
IPV4 address to be assigned to the public interface of the network router. This address will be used as source NAT address for the network. 
If an address is given and it cannot be acquired, an error will be returned and the network won´t be implemented,

parameters.name: cidrsize
parameters.description: the CIDR size of IPv4 network. For regular users, this is required for isolated networks with ROUTED mode.

parameters.name: asnumber
parameters.description: the AS Number of the network

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.admin..description: Creates a network offering.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the network offering

parameters.name: displaytext
parameters.description: the display text of the network offering, defaults to the value of 'name'.

parameters.name: traffictype
parameters.description: the traffic type for the network offering. Supported type in current release is GUEST only

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: the tags for the network offering.

parameters.name: specifyvlan
parameters.description: true if network offering supports vlans

parameters.name: availability
parameters.description: the availability of network offering. The default value is Optional.  Another value is Required, which will make it as the default network offering for new networks

parameters.name: networkrate
parameters.description: data transfer rate in megabits per second allowed

parameters.name: conservemode
parameters.description: true if the network offering is IP conserve mode enabled

parameters.name: serviceofferingid
parameters.description: the service offering ID used by virtual router provider

parameters.name: guestiptype
parameters.description: guest type of the network offering: Shared or Isolated

parameters.name: internetprotocol
parameters.description: The internet protocol of network offering. Options are ipv4 and dualstack. Default is ipv4. dualstack will create a network offering that supports both IPv4 and IPv6

parameters.name: supportedservices
parameters.description: services supported by the network offering

parameters.name: serviceproviderlist
parameters.description: provider to service mapping. If not specified, the provider for the service will be mapped to the default provider on the physical network

parameters.name: servicecapabilitylist
parameters.description: desired service capabilities as part of network offering

parameters.name: specifyipranges
parameters.description: true if network offering supports specifying ip ranges; defaulted to false if not specified

parameters.name: ispersistent
parameters.description: true if network offering supports persistent networks; defaulted to false if not specified

parameters.name: forvpc
parameters.description: true if network offering is meant to be used for VPC, false otherwise.

parameters.name: fornsx
parameters.description: true if network offering is meant to be used for NSX, false otherwise.

parameters.name: nsxsupportlb
parameters.description: true if network offering for NSX network offering supports Load balancer service.

parameters.name: nsxsupportsinternallb
parameters.description: true if network offering for NSX network offering supports Internal Load balancer service.

parameters.name: networkmode
parameters.description: Indicates the mode with which the network will operate. Valid option: NATTED or ROUTED

parameters.name: fortungsten
parameters.description: true if network offering is meant to be used for Tungsten-Fabric, false otherwise.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Network offering details in key/value pairs. Supported keys are internallbprovider/publiclbprovider with service provider as a value, and promiscuousmode/macaddresschanges/forgedtransmits with true/false as value to accept/reject the security settings if available for a nic/portgroup

parameters.name: egressdefaultpolicy
parameters.description: true if guest network default egress policy is allow; false if default egress policy is deny

parameters.name: keepaliveenabled
parameters.description: if true keepalive will be turned on in the loadbalancer. At the time of writing this has only an effect on haproxy; the mode http and httpclose options are unset in the haproxy conf file.

parameters.name: maxconnections
parameters.description: maximum number of concurrent connections supported by the network offering

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: the ID of the containing domain(s), null for public offerings

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: the ID of the containing zone(s), null for public offerings

parameters.name: enable
parameters.description: set to true if the offering is to be enabled during creation. Default is false

parameters.name: specifyasnumber
parameters.description: true if network offering supports choosing AS number

parameters.name: routingmode
parameters.description: the routing mode for the network offering. Supported types are: Static or Dynamic.

parameters.description: The display text of the template, defaults to the 'name'.

parameters.name: isfeatured
parameters.description: true if this template is a featured template, false otherwise

parameters.name: ispublic
parameters.description: true if this template is a public template, false otherwise

parameters.name: ostypeid
parameters.description: the ID of the OS Type that best represents the OS of this template.

parameters.name: passwordenabled
parameters.description: true if the template supports the password reset feature; default is false

parameters.name: sshkeyenabled
parameters.description: true if the template supports the sshkey upload feature; default is false

parameters.name: requireshvm
parameters.description: true if the template requires HVM, false otherwise

parameters.name: snapshotid
parameters.description: the ID of the snapshot the template is being created from. Either this parameter, or volumeId has to be passed in

parameters.name: volumeid
parameters.description: the ID of the disk volume the template is being created from. Either this parameter, or snapshotId has to be passed in

parameters.name: virtualmachineid
parameters.description: Optional, VM ID. If this presents, it is going to create a baremetal template for VM this ID refers to. This is only for VM whose hypervisor type is BareMetal

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Optional, only for baremetal hypervisor. The directory name where template stored on CIFS server

parameters.name: templatetag

parameters.description: ID of the zone the template is being copied to.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Template ID.

parameters.name: sourcezoneid
parameters.description: ID of the zone the template is currently hosted on. If not specified and template is cross-zone, then we will sync this template to region wide image store.

parameters.name: destzoneids
parameters.description: A list of IDs of the zones that the template needs to be copied to.Specify this list if the template needs to copied to multiple zones in one go. Do not specify destzoneid and destzoneids together, however one of them is required.

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.admin..description: Registers an existing template into the CloudStack cloud.

parameters.name: bits
parameters.description: 32 or 64 bits support. 64 by default

parameters.name: displaytext
parameters.description: The display text of the template, defaults to 'name'.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: the format for the template. Possible values include QCOW2, RAW, VHD and OVA.

parameters.name: hypervisor
parameters.description: the target hypervisor for the template

parameters.name: isfeatured
parameters.description: true if this template is a featured template, false otherwise

parameters.name: ispublic
parameters.description: true if the template is available to all accounts; default is true

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the template

parameters.name: ostypeid
parameters.description: the ID of the OS Type that best represents the OS of this template. Not applicable with VMware, as we honour what is defined in the template

parameters.name: passwordenabled
parameters.description: true if the template supports the password reset feature; default is false

parameters.name: sshkeyenabled
parameters.description: true if the template supports the sshkey upload feature; default is false

parameters.name: isextractable
parameters.description: true if the template or its derivatives are extractable; default is false

parameters.name: requireshvm
parameters.description: true if this template requires HVM

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: the URL of where the template is hosted. Possible URL include http:// and https://

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: the ID of the zone the template is to be hosted on

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: an optional domainId. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: an optional accountName. Must be used with domainId.

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description:
the checksum value of this template. The parameter containing the checksum will be considered a MD5sum if it is not prefixed
 and just a plain ascii/utf8 representation of a hexadecimal string. If it is required to
 use another algorithm the hexadecimal string is to be prefixed with a string of the form,
 "{<algorithm>}", not including the double quotes. In this <algorithm> is the exact string
 representing the java supported algorithm, i.e. MD5 or SHA-256. Note that java does not
 contain an algorithm called SHA256 or one called sha-256, only SHA-256.

parameters.name: templatetag
parameters.description: the tag for this template.

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: Register template for the project

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Template details in key/value pairs using format details[i].keyname=keyvalue. Example: details[0].hypervisortoolsversion=xenserver61

parameters.name: isdynamicallyscalable
parameters.description: true if template contains XS/VMWare tools inorder to support dynamic scaling of VM cpu/memory

parameters.name: isrouting
parameters.description: true if the template type is routing i.e., if template is used to deploy router

parameters.name: zoneids
parameters.description: A list of zone ids where the template will be hosted. Use this parameter if the template needs to be registered to multiple zones in one go. Use zoneid if the template needs to be registered to only one zone.Passing only -1 to this will cause the template to be registered as a cross zone template and will be copied to all zones.

parameters.name: directdownload
parameters.description: true if template should bypass Secondary Storage and be downloaded to Primary Storage on deployment

parameters.name: deployasis
parameters.description: (VMware only) true if VM deployments should preserve all the configurations defined for this template

parameters.name: templatetype
parameters.description: the type of the template. Valid options are: USER/VNF (for all users) and SYSTEM/ROUTING/BUILTIN (for admins only).

parameters.name: arch
parameters.description: the CPU arch of the template. Valid options are: x86_64, aarch64

parameters.description: the ID of the zone the template is to be hosted on

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: an optional domainId. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: an optional accountName. Must be used with domainId.

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description:
the checksum value of this template. The parameter containing the checksum will be considered a MD5sum if it is not prefixed
 and just a plain ascii/utf8 representation of a hexadecimal string. If it is required to
 use another algorithm the hexadecimal string is to be prefixed with a string of the form,
 "{<algorithm>}", not including the double quotes. In this <algorithm> is the exact string
 representing the java supported algorithm, i.e. MD5 or SHA-256. Note that java does not
 contain an algorithm called SHA256 or one called sha-256, only SHA-256.

parameters.name: templatetag
parameters.description: the tag for this template.

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: Register template for the project

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Template details in key/value pairs using format details[i].keyname=keyvalue. Example: details[0].hypervisortoolsversion=xenserver61

parameters.name: isdynamicallyscalable
parameters.description: true if template contains XS/VMWare tools inorder to support dynamic scaling of VM cpu/memory

parameters.name: isrouting
parameters.description: true if the template type is routing i.e., if template is used to deploy router

parameters.name: zoneids
parameters.description: A list of zone ids where the template will be hosted. Use this parameter if the template needs to be registered to multiple zones in one go. Use zoneid if the template needs to be registered to only one zone.Passing only -1 to this will cause the template to be registered as a cross zone template and will be copied to all zones.

parameters.name: directdownload
parameters.description: true if template should bypass Secondary Storage and be downloaded to Primary Storage on deployment

parameters.name: deployasis
parameters.description: (VMware only) true if VM deployments should preserve all the configurations defined for this template

parameters.name: templatetype
parameters.description: the type of the template. Valid options are: USER/VNF (for all users) and SYSTEM/ROUTING/BUILTIN (for admins only).

parameters.name: arch
parameters.description: the CPU arch of the template. Valid options are: x86_64, aarch64

parameters.description: List usage records for the specified domain.

parameters.name: enddate
parameters.description: End date range for usage record query. The recommended format is "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ" (e.g.: "2023-01-01T12:00:00+0100"); however, the following formats are also accepted: "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" (e.g.: "2023-01-01 12:00:00") and "yyyy-MM-dd" (e.g.: "2023-01-01" - if the time is not added, it will be interpreted as "23:59:59"). If the recommended format is not used, the date will be considered in the server timezone.

parameters.name: startdate
parameters.description: Start date range for usage record query. The recommended format is "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ" (e.g.: "2023-01-01T12:00:00+0100"); however, the following formats are also accepted: "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" (e.g.: "2023-01-01 12:00:00") and "yyyy-MM-dd" (e.g.: "2023-01-01" - if the time is not added, it will be interpreted as "00:00:00"). If the recommended format is not used, the date will be considered in the server timezone.

parameters.description: The heuristic rule, in JavaScript language. It is required that it returns the UUID of a secondary storage pool. An example of a rule is `if (snapshot.hypervisorType === 'KVM') { '7832f261-c602-4e8e-8580-2496ffbbc45d'; }` would allocate all snapshots with the KVM hypervisor to the specified secondary storage UUID.

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.admin..description: Attempts Migration of a VM with its volumes to a different host

parameters.name: hostid
parameters.description: Destination Host ID to migrate VM to.

parameters.name: virtualmachineid
parameters.description: the ID of the virtual machine

parameters.name: migrateto
parameters.description: Storage to pool mapping. This parameter specifies the mapping between a volume and a pool where you want to migrate that volume. Format of this parameter: migrateto[volume-index].volume=<uuid>&migrateto[volume-index].pool=<uuid>Where, [volume-index] indicates the index to identify the volume that you want to migrate, volume=<uuid> indicates the UUID of the volume that you want to migrate, and pool=<uuid> indicates the UUID of the pool where you want to migrate the volume. Example: migrateto[0].volume=<71f43cd6-69b0-4d3b-9fbc-67f50963d60b>&migrateto[0].pool=<a382f181-3d2b-4413-b92d-b8931befa7e1>&migrateto[1].volume=<88de0173-55c0-4c1c-a269-83d0279eeedf>&migrateto[1].pool=<95d6e97c-6766-4d67-9a30-c449c15011d1>&migrateto[2].volume=<1b331390-59f2-4796-9993-bf11c6e76225>&migrateto[2].pool=<41fdb564-9d3b-447d-88ed-7628f7640cbc>

parameters.name: autoselect
parameters.description: Automatically select a destination host for a running instance, if hostId is not specified. false by default

parameters.description: Virtual Machine ID

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.admin..description: Creates and automatically starts a VNF appliance based on a service offering, disk offering, and template.

parameters.name: vnfconfiguremanagement
parameters.description: True by default, security group or network rules (source nat and firewall rules) will be configured for VNF management interfaces. False otherwise. Network rules are configured if management network is an isolated network or shared network with security groups.

parameters.name: vnfcidrlist
parameters.description: the CIDR list to forward traffic from to the VNF management interface. Multiple entries must be separated by a single comma character (,). The default value is 0.0.0.0/0.

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: availability zone for the virtual machine

parameters.name: serviceofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the service offering for the virtual machine

parameters.name: templateid
parameters.description: the ID of the template for the virtual machine

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: host name for the virtual machine

parameters.name: displayname
parameters.description: an optional user generated name for the virtual machine

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password of the virtual machine. If null, a random password will be generated for the VM.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: an optional account for the virtual machine. Must be used with domainId.

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: an optional domainId for the virtual machine. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used. If account is NOT provided then virtual machine will be assigned to the caller account and domain.

parameters.name: networkids
parameters.description: list of network ids used by virtual machine. Can't be specified with ipToNetworkList parameter

parameters.name: boottype
parameters.description: Guest VM Boot option either custom[UEFI] or default boot [BIOS]. Not applicable with VMware if the template is marked as deploy-as-is, as we honour what is defined in the template.

parameters.name: bootmode
parameters.description: Boot Mode [Legacy] or [Secure] Applicable when Boot Type Selected is UEFI, otherwise Legacy only for BIOS. Not applicable with VMware if the template is marked as deploy-as-is, as we honour what is defined in the template.

parameters.name: bootintosetup
parameters.description: Boot into hardware setup or not (ignored if startVm = false, only valid for vmware)

parameters.name: diskofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the disk offering for the virtual machine. If the template is of ISO format, the diskOfferingId is for the root disk volume. Otherwise this parameter is used to indicate the offering for the data disk volume. If the templateId parameter passed is from a Template object, the diskOfferingId refers to a DATA Disk Volume created. If the templateId parameter passed is from an ISO object, the diskOfferingId refers to a ROOT Disk Volume created.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: the arbitrary size for the DATADISK volume. Mutually exclusive with diskOfferingId

parameters.name: rootdisksize
parameters.description: Optional field to resize root disk on deploy. Value is in GB. Only applies to template-based deployments. Analogous to details[0].rootdisksize, which takes precedence over this parameter if both are provided

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: an optional group for the virtual machine

parameters.name: hypervisor
parameters.description: the hypervisor on which to deploy the virtual machine. The parameter is required and respected only when hypervisor info is not set on the ISO/Template passed to the call

parameters.name: userdata
parameters.description: an optional binary data that can be sent to the virtual machine upon a successful deployment. This binary data must be base64 encoded before adding it to the request. Using HTTP GET (via querystring), you can send up to 4KB of data after base64 encoding. Using HTTP POST (via POST body), you can send up to 1MB of data after base64 encoding. You also need to change vm.userdata.max.length value

parameters.name: userdataid
parameters.description: the ID of the Userdata

parameters.name: userdatadetails
parameters.description: used to specify the parameters values for the variables in userdata.

parameters.name: keypair
parameters.description: name of the ssh key pair used to login to the virtual machine

parameters.name: keypairs
parameters.description: names of the ssh key pairs used to login to the virtual machine

parameters.name: hostid
parameters.description: destination Host ID to deploy the VM to - parameter available for root admin only

parameters.name: securitygroupids
parameters.description: comma separated list of security groups id that going to be applied to the virtual machine. Should be passed only when vm is created from a zone with Basic Network support. Mutually exclusive with securitygroupnames parameter

parameters.name: securitygroupnames
parameters.description: comma separated list of security groups names that going to be applied to the virtual machine. Should be passed only when vm is created from a zone with Basic Network support. Mutually exclusive with securitygroupids parameter

parameters.name: iptonetworklist
parameters.description: ip to network mapping. Can't be specified with networkIds parameter. Example: iptonetworklist[0].ip=10.10.10.11&iptonetworklist[0].ipv6=fc00:1234:5678::abcd&iptonetworklist[0].networkid=uuid&iptonetworklist[0].mac=aa:bb:cc:dd:ee::ff - requests to use ip 10.10.10.11 in network id=uuid

parameters.name: ipaddress
parameters.description: the ip address for default vm's network

parameters.name: ip6address
parameters.description: the ipv6 address for default vm's network

parameters.name: macaddress
parameters.description: the mac address for default vm's network

parameters.name: keyboard
parameters.description: an optional keyboard device type for the virtual machine. valid value can be one of de,de-ch,es,fi,fr,fr-be,fr-ch,is,it,jp,nl-be,no,pt,uk,us

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: Deploy vm for the project

parameters.name: startvm
parameters.description: true if start vm after creating; defaulted to true if not specified

parameters.name: affinitygroupids
parameters.description: comma separated list of affinity groups id that are going to be applied to the virtual machine. Mutually exclusive with affinitygroupnames parameter

parameters.name: affinitygroupnames
parameters.description: comma separated list of affinity groups names that are going to be applied to the virtual machine.Mutually exclusive with affinitygroupids parameter

parameters.name: displayvm
parameters.description: an optional field, whether to the display the vm to the end user or not.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: used to specify the custom parameters. 'extraconfig' is not allowed to be passed in details

parameters.name: deploymentplanner
parameters.description: Deployment planner to use for vm allocation. Available to ROOT admin only

parameters.name: dhcpoptionsnetworklist
parameters.description: DHCP options which are passed to the VM on start up Example: dhcpoptionsnetworklist[0].dhcp:114=url&dhcpoptionsetworklist[0].networkid=networkid&dhcpoptionsetworklist[0].dhcp:66=www.test.com

parameters.name: datadiskofferinglist
parameters.description: datadisk template to disk-offering mapping; an optional parameter used to create additional data disks from datadisk templates; can't be specified with diskOfferingId parameter

parameters.name: extraconfig
parameters.description: an optional URL encoded string that can be passed to the virtual machine upon successful deployment

parameters.name: copyimagetags
parameters.description: if true the image tags (if any) will be copied to the VM, default value is false

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: used to specify the vApp properties.

parameters.name: nicnetworklist
parameters.description: VMware only: used to specify network mapping of a vApp VMware template registered "as-is". Example nicnetworklist[0].ip=Nic-101&nicnetworklist[0].network=uuid

parameters.name: dynamicscalingenabled
parameters.description: true if virtual machine needs to be dynamically scalable

parameters.name: overridediskofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the disk offering for the virtual machine to be used for root volume instead of the disk offering mapped in service offering.In case of virtual machine deploying from ISO, then the diskofferingid specified for root volume is ignored and uses this override disk offering id

parameters.name: iothreadsenabled
parameters.description: IOThreads are dedicated event loop threads for supported disk devices to perform block I/O requests in order to improve scalability especially on an SMP host/guest with many LUNs.

parameters.name: iodriverpolicy
parameters.description: Controls specific policies on IO

parameters.name: nicmultiqueuenumber
parameters.description: The number of queues for multiqueue NICs.

parameters.name: nicpackedvirtqueuesenabled
parameters.description: Enable packed virtqueues or not.

parameters.name: customid
parameters.description: an optional field, in case you want to set a custom id to the resource. Allowed to Root Admins only

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.admin..description: Creates and automatically starts a virtual machine based on a service offering, disk offering, and template.

parameters.name: podid
parameters.description: destination Pod ID to deploy the VM to - parameter available for root admin only

parameters.name: clusterid
parameters.description: destination Cluster ID to deploy the VM to - parameter available for root admin only

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: availability zone for the virtual machine

parameters.name: serviceofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the service offering for the virtual machine

parameters.name: templateid
parameters.description: the ID of the template for the virtual machine

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: host name for the virtual machine

parameters.name: displayname
parameters.description: an optional user generated name for the virtual machine

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password of the virtual machine. If null, a random password will be generated for the VM.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: an optional account for the virtual machine. Must be used with domainId.

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: an optional domainId for the virtual machine. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used. If account is NOT provided then virtual machine will be assigned to the caller account and domain.

parameters.name: networkids
parameters.description: list of network ids used by virtual machine. Can't be specified with ipToNetworkList parameter

parameters.name: boottype
parameters.description: Guest VM Boot option either custom[UEFI] or default boot [BIOS]. Not applicable with VMware if the template is marked as deploy-as-is, as we honour what is defined in the template.

parameters.name: bootmode
parameters.description: Boot Mode [Legacy] or [Secure] Applicable when Boot Type Selected is UEFI, otherwise Legacy only for BIOS. Not applicable with VMware if the template is marked as deploy-as-is, as we honour what is defined in the template.

parameters.name: bootintosetup
parameters.description: Boot into hardware setup or not (ignored if startVm = false, only valid for vmware)

parameters.name: diskofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the disk offering for the virtual machine. If the template is of ISO format, the diskOfferingId is for the root disk volume. Otherwise this parameter is used to indicate the offering for the data disk volume. If the templateId parameter passed is from a Template object, the diskOfferingId refers to a DATA Disk Volume created. If the templateId parameter passed is from an ISO object, the diskOfferingId refers to a ROOT Disk Volume created.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: the arbitrary size for the DATADISK volume. Mutually exclusive with diskOfferingId

parameters.name: rootdisksize
parameters.description: Optional field to resize root disk on deploy. Value is in GB. Only applies to template-based deployments. Analogous to details[0].rootdisksize, which takes precedence over this parameter if both are provided

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: an optional group for the virtual machine

parameters.name: hypervisor
parameters.description: the hypervisor on which to deploy the virtual machine. The parameter is required and respected only when hypervisor info is not set on the ISO/Template passed to the call

parameters.name: userdata
parameters.description: an optional binary data that can be sent to the virtual machine upon a successful deployment. This binary data must be base64 encoded before adding it to the request. Using HTTP GET (via querystring), you can send up to 4KB of data after base64 encoding. Using HTTP POST (via POST body), you can send up to 1MB of data after base64 encoding. You also need to change vm.userdata.max.length value

parameters.name: userdataid
parameters.description: the ID of the Userdata

parameters.name: userdatadetails
parameters.description: used to specify the parameters values for the variables in userdata.

parameters.name: keypair
parameters.description: name of the ssh key pair used to login to the virtual machine

parameters.name: keypairs
parameters.description: names of the ssh key pairs used to login to the virtual machine

parameters.name: hostid
parameters.description: destination Host ID to deploy the VM to - parameter available for root admin only

parameters.name: securitygroupids
parameters.description: comma separated list of security groups id that going to be applied to the virtual machine. Should be passed only when vm is created from a zone with Basic Network support. Mutually exclusive with securitygroupnames parameter

parameters.name: securitygroupnames
parameters.description: comma separated list of security groups names that going to be applied to the virtual machine. Should be passed only when vm is created from a zone with Basic Network support. Mutually exclusive with securitygroupids parameter

parameters.name: iptonetworklist
parameters.description: ip to network mapping. Can't be specified with networkIds parameter. Example: iptonetworklist[0].ip=10.10.10.11&iptonetworklist[0].ipv6=fc00:1234:5678::abcd&iptonetworklist[0].networkid=uuid&iptonetworklist[0].mac=aa:bb:cc:dd:ee::ff - requests to use ip 10.10.10.11 in network id=uuid

parameters.name: ipaddress
parameters.description: the ip address for default vm's network

parameters.name: ip6address
parameters.description: the ipv6 address for default vm's network

parameters.name: macaddress
parameters.description: the mac address for default vm's network

parameters.name: keyboard
parameters.description: an optional keyboard device type for the virtual machine. valid value can be one of de,de-ch,es,fi,fr,fr-be,fr-ch,is,it,jp,nl-be,no,pt,uk,us

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: Deploy vm for the project

parameters.name: startvm
parameters.description: true if start vm after creating; defaulted to true if not specified

parameters.name: affinitygroupids
parameters.description: comma separated list of affinity groups id that are going to be applied to the virtual machine. Mutually exclusive with affinitygroupnames parameter

parameters.name: affinitygroupnames
parameters.description: comma separated list of affinity groups names that are going to be applied to the virtual machine.Mutually exclusive with affinitygroupids parameter

parameters.name: displayvm
parameters.description: an optional field, whether to the display the vm to the end user or not.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: used to specify the custom parameters. 'extraconfig' is not allowed to be passed in details

parameters.name: deploymentplanner
parameters.description: Deployment planner to use for vm allocation. Available to ROOT admin only

parameters.name: dhcpoptionsnetworklist
parameters.description: DHCP options which are passed to the VM on start up Example: dhcpoptionsnetworklist[0].dhcp:114=url&dhcpoptionsetworklist[0].networkid=networkid&dhcpoptionsetworklist[0].dhcp:66=www.test.com

parameters.name: datadiskofferinglist
parameters.description: datadisk template to disk-offering mapping; an optional parameter used to create additional data disks from datadisk templates; can't be specified with diskOfferingId parameter

parameters.name: extraconfig
parameters.description: an optional URL encoded string that can be passed to the virtual machine upon successful deployment

parameters.name: copyimagetags
parameters.description: if true the image tags (if any) will be copied to the VM, default value is false

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: used to specify the vApp properties.

parameters.name: nicnetworklist
parameters.description: VMware only: used to specify network mapping of a vApp VMware template registered "as-is". Example nicnetworklist[0].ip=Nic-101&nicnetworklist[0].network=uuid

parameters.name: dynamicscalingenabled
parameters.description: true if virtual machine needs to be dynamically scalable

parameters.name: overridediskofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the disk offering for the virtual machine to be used for root volume instead of the disk offering mapped in service offering.In case of virtual machine deploying from ISO, then the diskofferingid specified for root volume is ignored and uses this override disk offering id

parameters.name: iothreadsenabled
parameters.description: IOThreads are dedicated event loop threads for supported disk devices to perform block I/O requests in order to improve scalability especially on an SMP host/guest with many LUNs.

parameters.name: iodriverpolicy
parameters.description: Controls specific policies on IO

parameters.name: nicmultiqueuenumber
parameters.description: The number of queues for multiqueue NICs.

parameters.name: nicpackedvirtqueuesenabled
parameters.description: Enable packed virtqueues or not.

parameters.name: customid
parameters.description: an optional field, in case you want to set a custom id to the resource. Allowed to Root Admins only

This API is available for Basic zones with security groups and Advanced zones with guest networks. A root administrator can reassign a VM from any account to any other account in any domain. A domain administrator can reassign a VM to any account in the same domain.

parameters.name: securitygroupids
parameters.description: list of security group ids to be applied on the virtual machine. In case no security groups are provided the VM is part of the default security group.

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.admin..description: Updates properties of a virtual machine. The VM has to be stopped and restarted for the new properties to take effect. parameters.description: an optional binary data that can be sent to the virtual machine upon a successful deployment. This binary data must be base64 encoded before adding it to the request. Using HTTP GET (via querystring), you can send up to 4KB of data after base64 encoding. Using HTTP POST (via POST body), you can send up to 1MB of data after base64 encoding. You also need to change vm.userdata.max.length value

parameters.description: list of security group ids to be applied on the virtual machine.

parameters.description: comma separated list of security groups names that going to be applied to the virtual machine. Should be passed only when vm is created from a zone with Basic Network support. Mutually exclusive with securitygroupids parameter

parameters.description: optional boolean field, which indicates if details should be cleaned up or not (if set to true, details removed for this resource, details field ignored; if false or not set, no action)

parameters.description: DHCP options which are passed to the VM on start up Example: dhcpoptionsnetworklist[0].dhcp:114=url&dhcpoptionsetworklist[0].networkid=networkid&dhcpoptionsetworklist[0].dhcp:66=www.test.com

parameters.description: an optional URL encoded string that can be passed to the virtual machine upon successful deployment

parameters.name: customid
parameters.description: an optional field, in case you want to set a custom id to the resource. Allowed to Root Admins only

parameters.description: list accounts by account type. Valid account types are 1 (admin), 2 (domain-admin), and 0 (user).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: list account by account ID

parameters.name: iscleanuprequired
parameters.description: list accounts by cleanuprequired attribute (values are true or false)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: list account by account name

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: list accounts by state. Valid states are enabled, disabled, and locked.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: comma separated list of account details requested, value can be a list of [ all, resource, min]

parameters.name: apikeyaccess
parameters.description: List accounts by the Api key access value

parameters.name: showicon
parameters.description: flag to display the resource icon for accounts

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Tag for resource type to return usage

parameters.name: listall
parameters.description: If set to false, list only resources belonging to the command's caller; if set to true - list resources that the caller is authorized to see. Default value is false. Resources dedicated to a project are listed only if using the projectid parameter.

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: list only resources belonging to the domain specified

parameters.name: isrecursive
parameters.description: defaults to false, but if true, lists all resources from the parent specified by the domainId till leaves.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: List by keyword

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.admin..description: Uploads a custom certificate for the console proxy VMs to use for SSL. Can be used to upload a single certificate signed by a known CA. Can also be used, through multiple calls, to upload a chain of certificates from CA to the custom certificate itself.

parameters.name: certificate
parameters.description: The certificate to be uploaded.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An integer providing the location in a chain that the certificate will hold. Usually, this can be left empty. When creating a chain, the top level certificate should have an ID of 1, with each step in the chain incrementing by one. Example, CA with id = 1, Intermediate CA with id = 2, Site certificate with ID = 3

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A name / alias for the certificate.

parameters.name: privatekey
parameters.description: The private key for the attached certificate.

parameters.name: domainsuffix
parameters.description: DNS domain suffix that the certificate is granted for.

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.admin..description: Creates a service offering.

parameters.name: cpunumber
parameters.description: the CPU number of the service offering

parameters.name: cpuspeed
parameters.description:
For VMware and Xen based hypervisors this is the CPU speed of the service offering in MHz.
For the KVM hypervisor, the values of the parameters cpuSpeed and cpuNumber will be used to calculate the `shares` value. This value is used by the KVM hypervisor to calculate how much time the VM will have access to the host's CPU. The `shares` value does not have a unit, and its purpose is being a weight value for the host to compare between its guest VMs. For more information, see https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#cpu-tuning.

parameters.name: displaytext
parameters.description: The display text of the service offering, defaults to 'name'.

parameters.name: provisioningtype
parameters.description: provisioning type used to create volumes. Valid values are thin, sparse, fat.

parameters.name: memory
parameters.description: the total memory of the service offering in MB

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the service offering

parameters.name: offerha
parameters.description: the HA for the service offering

parameters.name: limitcpuuse
parameters.description: restrict the CPU usage to committed service offering

parameters.name: isvolatile
parameters.description: true if the virtual machine needs to be volatile so that on every reboot of VM, original root disk is dettached then destroyed and a fresh root disk is created and attached to VM

parameters.name: storagetype
parameters.description: the storage type of the service offering. Values are local and shared.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: the tags for this service offering.

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: the ID of the containing domain(s), null for public offerings

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: the ID of the containing zone(s), null for public offerings

parameters.name: hosttags
parameters.description: the host tag for this service offering.

parameters.name: issystem
parameters.description: is this a system vm offering

parameters.name: systemvmtype
parameters.description: the system VM type. Possible types are "domainrouter", "consoleproxy" and "secondarystoragevm".

parameters.name: networkrate
parameters.description: data transfer rate in megabits per second allowed. Supported only for non-System offering and system offerings having "domainrouter" systemvmtype

parameters.name: deploymentplanner

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.admin..description: Uploads a data disk.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: the format for the volume. Possible values include QCOW2, OVA, and VHD.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the volume

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: the URL of where the volume is hosted. Possible URL include http:// and https://

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: the ID of the zone the volume is to be hosted on

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: an optional domainId. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used. If account is NOT provided then volume will be assigned to the caller account and domain.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: an optional accountName. Must be used with domainId.

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description:
the checksum value of this volume. The parameter containing the checksum will be considered a MD5sum if it is not prefixed
 and just a plain ascii/utf8 representation of a hexadecimal string. If it is required to
 use another algorithm the hexadecimal string is to be prefixed with a string of the form,
 "{<algorithm>}", not including the double quotes. In this <algorithm> is the exact string
 representing the java supported algorithm, i.e. MD5 or SHA-256. Note that java does not
 contain an algorithm called SHA256 or one called sha-256, only SHA-256.

parameters.name: imagestoreuuid
parameters.description: Image store uuid

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: Upload volume for the project

parameters.name: diskofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the disk offering. This must be a custom sized offering since during uploadVolume volume size is unknown.

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.admin..description: Attaches a disk volume to a virtual machine.

parameters.name: deviceid
parameters.description:
The ID of the device to map the volume to the guest OS. If no deviceID is informed, the next available deviceID will be chosen. Use 0 when volume needs to be attached as ROOT.
When using a linux operating system and the hypervisor XenServer, the devices IDs will be mapped as follows:
  • 0 maps to /dev/xvda;
  • 1 maps to /dev/xvdb;
  • 2 maps /dev/xvdc and so on.
Please refer to the docs of your hypervisor for the correct mapping of the deviceID and the actual logical disk structure.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the ID of the disk volume

parameters.name: virtualmachineid
parameters.description: the ID of the virtual machine

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description:
the checksum value of this ISO. The parameter containing the checksum will be considered a MD5sum if it is not prefixed
 and just a plain ascii/utf8 representation of a hexadecimal string. If it is required to
 use another algorithm the hexadecimal string is to be prefixed with a string of the form,
 "{<algorithm>}", not including the double quotes. In this <algorithm> is the exact string
 representing the java supported algorithm, i.e. MD5 or SHA-256. Note that java does not
 contain an algorithm called SHA256 or one called sha-256, only SHA-256.

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.user.n.description: Move an ACL rule to a position bettwen two other ACL rules of the same ACL network list

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the network ACL rule that is being moved to a new position.

parameters.name: previousaclruleid
parameters.description: The ID of the first rule that is right before the new position where the rule being moved is going to be placed. This value can be 'NULL' if the rule is being moved to the first position of the network ACL list.

parameters.name: nextaclruleid
parameters.description: The ID of the rule that is right after the new position where the rule being moved is going to be placed. This value can be 'NULL' if the rule is being moved to the last position of the network ACL list.

parameters.name: aclconsistencyhash
parameters.description: Md5 hash used to check the consistency of the ACL rule list before applying the ACL rule move. This check is useful to manage concurrency problems that may happen when multiple users are editing the same ACL rule listing. The parameter is not required. Therefore, if the user does not send it, they assume the risk of moving ACL rules without checking the consistency of the access control list before executing the move. We use MD5 hash function on a String that is composed of all UUIDs of the ACL rules in concatenated in their respective order (order defined via 'number' field).

parameters.name: customid

parameters.name: bits
parameters.description: 32 or 64 bit

parameters.name: displaytext
parameters.description: The display text of the template, defaults to the 'name'.

parameters.name: isfeatured
parameters.description: true if this template is a featured template, false otherwise

parameters.name: ispublic

parameters.name: ostypeid

parameters.name: passwordenabled

parameters.name: sshkeyenabled
parameters.description: true if the template supports the sshkey upload feature; default is false

parameters.name: requireshvm
parameters.description: true if the template requires HVM, false otherwise

parameters.description: the ID of the snapshot the template is being created from. Either this parameter, or volumeId has to be passed in

parameters.name: volumeid
parameters.description: the ID of the disk volume the template is being created from. Either this parameter, or snapshotId has to be passed in

parameters.name: virtualmachineid
parameters.description: Optional, VM ID. If this presents, it is going to create a baremetal template for VM this ID refers to. This is only for VM whose hypervisor type is BareMetal

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Optional, only for baremetal hypervisor. The directory name where template stored on CIFS server

parameters.name: templatetag
parameters.description: the tag for this template.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Template details in key/value pairs using format details[i].keyname=keyvalue. Example: details[0].hypervisortoolsversion=xenserver61

parameters.name: isdynamicallyscalable
parameters.description: true if template contains XS/VMWare tools inorder to support dynamic scaling of VM cpu/memory

parameters.name: projectid

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: the zone for the template. Can be specified with snapshot only

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: an optional domainId. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: an optional accountName. Must be used with domainId.

parameters.name: displaytext

parameters.name: arch
parameters.description: the CPU arch of the template. Valid options are: x86_64, aarch64

parameters.name: bits
parameters.description: 32 or 64 bits support. 64 by default

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Template details in key/value pairs.

parameters.name: isdynamicallyscalable
parameters.description: true if template contains XS/VMWare tools inorder to support dynamic scaling of VM cpu/memory

parameters.name: isextractable
parameters.description: true if the template or its derivatives are extractable; default is false

parameters.name: isfeatured
parameters.description: true if this template is a featured template, false otherwise

parameters.name: ispublic
parameters.description: true if the template is available to all accounts; default is true

parameters.name: isrouting
parameters.description: true if the template type is routing i.e., if template is used to deploy router

parameters.name: passwordenabled
parameters.description: true if the template supports the password reset feature; default is false

parameters.name: requireshvm
parameters.description: true if this template requires HVM

parameters.name: sshkeyenabled
parameters.description: true if the template supports the sshkey upload feature; default is false

parameters.name: templatetag
parameters.description: the tag for this template.

parameters.name: deployasis
parameters.description: (VMware only) true if VM deployments should preserve all the configurations defined for this template

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the volume/template/iso

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: the format for the volume/template/iso. Possible values include QCOW2, OVA, and VHD.

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: the ID of the zone the volume/template/iso is to be hosted on

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description:
the checksum value of this volume/template/iso The parameter containing the checksum will be considered a MD5sum if it is not prefixed
 and just a plain ascii/utf8 representation of a hexadecimal string. If it is required to
 use another algorithm the hexadecimal string is to be prefixed with a string of the form,
 "{<algorithm>}", not including the double quotes. In this <algorithm> is the exact string
 representing the java supported algorithm, i.e. MD5 or SHA-256. Note that java does not
 contain an algorithm called SHA256 or one called sha-256, only SHA-256.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: an optional accountName. Must be used with domainId.

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: an optional domainId. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

parameters.name: projectid

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.user.t.description: List all public, private, and privileged VNF templates.

parameters.name: hypervisor
parameters.description: the hypervisor for which to restrict the search

parameters.description: the IDs of the templates, mutually exclusive with id

parameters.description: the template name

parameters.name: templatefilter
parameters.description: possible values are "featured", "self", "selfexecutable","sharedexecutable","executable", and "community". * featured : templates that have been marked as featured and public. * self : templates that have been registered or created by the calling user. * selfexecutable : same as self, but only returns templates that can be used to deploy a new VM. * sharedexecutable : templates ready to be deployed that have been granted to the calling user by another user. * executable : templates that are owned by the calling user, or public templates, that can be used to deploy a VM. * community : templates that have been marked as public but not featured. * all : all templates (only usable by admins).

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.user.a.description: Updates an existing autoscale vm profile.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the ID of the autoscale vm profile

parameters.name: serviceofferingid
parameters.description: the service offering of the auto deployed virtual machine

parameters.name: templateid
parameters.description: the template of the auto deployed virtual machine

parameters.name: expungevmgraceperiod
parameters.description: the time allowed for existing connections to get closed before a vm is destroyed

parameters.name: counterparam
parameters.description: counterparam list. Example: counterparam[0].name=snmpcommunity&counterparam[0].value=public&counterparam[1].name=snmpport&counterparam[1].value=161

parameters.name: otherdeployparams
parameters.description:
parameters other than zoneId/serviceOfferringId/templateId of the auto deployed virtual machine. 
Example: otherdeployparams[0].name=serviceofferingid&otherdeployparams[0].value=a7fb50f6-01d9-11ed-8bc1-77f8f0228926&otherdeployparams[1].name=rootdisksize&otherdeployparams[1].value=10 .
Possible parameters are "rootdisksize", "diskofferingid","size", "securitygroupids", "overridediskofferingid", "keypairs", "affinitygroupids'" and "networkids".

parameters.name: userdata
parameters.description: an optional binary data that can be sent to the virtual machine upon a successful deployment. This binary data must be base64 encoded before adding it to the request. Using HTTP GET (via querystring), you can send up to 4KB of data after base64 encoding. Using HTTP POST (via POST body), you can send up to 1MB of data after base64 encoding. You also need to change vm.userdata.max.length value

parameters.name: userdataid
parameters.description: the ID of the userdata

parameters.name: userdatadetails
parameters.description: used to specify the parameters values for the variables in userdata.

parameters.name: autoscaleuserid
parameters.description: the ID of the user used to launch and destroy the VMs

parameters.name: fordisplay
parameters.description: an optional field, whether to the display the profile to the end user or not

parameters.description: an optional field, in case you want to set a custom id to the resource. Allowed to Root Admins only

parameters.description: the ID of the autoscale group

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: list objects by project; if projectid=-1 lists All VMs

parameters.description: If set to false, list only resources belonging to the command's caller; if set to true - list resources that the caller is authorized to see. Default value is false. Resources dedicated to a project are listed only if using the projectid parameter.

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.user.s.description: Create a new Shared File System of specified size and disk offering, attached to the given network

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the shared filesystem.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: the account associated with the shared filesystem. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: the domain ID associated with the shared filesystem. If used with the account parameter returns the shared filesystem associated with the account for the specified domain.If account is NOT provided then the shared filesystem will be assigned to the caller account and domain.

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: the project associated with the shared filesystem. Mutually exclusive with account parameter

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: the description for the shared filesystem.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: the size of the shared filesystem in GiB

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: the zone id.

parameters.name: diskofferingid
parameters.description: the disk offering to use for the underlying storage. This will define the size and other specifications like encryption and qos for the shared filesystem.

parameters.name: miniops
parameters.description: min iops

parameters.name: maxiops
parameters.description: max iops

parameters.name: serviceofferingid
parameters.description: the service offering to use for the shared filesystem instance hosting the data. The offering should be HA enabled and the cpu count and memory size should be greater than equal to sharedfsvm.min.cpu.count and sharedfsvm.min.ram.size respectively

parameters.name: filesystem
parameters.description: the filesystem format (XFS / EXT4) which will be installed on the shared filesystem.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: the provider to be used for the shared filesystem. The list of providers can be fetched by using the listSharedFileSystemProviders API.

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: network to attach the shared filesystem to

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.user.v.description: Creates and automatically starts a virtual machine based on a service offering, disk offering, and template.

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: availability zone for the virtual machine

parameters.name: serviceofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the service offering for the virtual machine

parameters.name: templateid
parameters.description: the ID of the template for the virtual machine

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: host name for the virtual machine

parameters.name: displayname
parameters.description: an optional user generated name for the virtual machine

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password of the virtual machine. If null, a random password will be generated for the VM.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: an optional account for the virtual machine. Must be used with domainId.

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: an optional domainId for the virtual machine. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used. If account is NOT provided then virtual machine will be assigned to the caller account and domain.

parameters.name: networkids
parameters.description: list of network ids used by virtual machine. Can't be specified with ipToNetworkList parameter

parameters.name: boottype
parameters.description: Guest VM Boot option either custom[UEFI] or default boot [BIOS]. Not applicable with VMware if the template is marked as deploy-as-is, as we honour what is defined in the template.

parameters.name: bootmode
parameters.description: Boot Mode [Legacy] or [Secure] Applicable when Boot Type Selected is UEFI, otherwise Legacy only for BIOS. Not applicable with VMware if the template is marked as deploy-as-is, as we honour what is defined in the template.

parameters.name: bootintosetup
parameters.description: Boot into hardware setup or not (ignored if startVm = false, only valid for vmware)

parameters.name: diskofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the disk offering for the virtual machine. If the template is of ISO format, the diskOfferingId is for the root disk volume. Otherwise this parameter is used to indicate the offering for the data disk volume. If the templateId parameter passed is from a Template object, the diskOfferingId refers to a DATA Disk Volume created. If the templateId parameter passed is from an ISO object, the diskOfferingId refers to a ROOT Disk Volume created.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: the arbitrary size for the DATADISK volume. Mutually exclusive with diskOfferingId

parameters.name: rootdisksize
parameters.description: Optional field to resize root disk on deploy. Value is in GB. Only applies to template-based deployments. Analogous to details[0].rootdisksize, which takes precedence over this parameter if both are provided

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: an optional group for the virtual machine

parameters.name: hypervisor
parameters.description: the hypervisor on which to deploy the virtual machine. The parameter is required and respected only when hypervisor info is not set on the ISO/Template passed to the call

parameters.name: userdata
parameters.description: an optional binary data that can be sent to the virtual machine upon a successful deployment. This binary data must be base64 encoded before adding it to the request. Using HTTP GET (via querystring), you can send up to 4KB of data after base64 encoding. Using HTTP POST (via POST body), you can send up to 1MB of data after base64 encoding. You also need to change vm.userdata.max.length value

parameters.name: userdataid
parameters.description: the ID of the Userdata

parameters.name: userdatadetails
parameters.description: used to specify the parameters values for the variables in userdata.

parameters.name: keypair
parameters.description: name of the ssh key pair used to login to the virtual machine

parameters.name: keypairs
parameters.description: names of the ssh key pairs used to login to the virtual machine

parameters.name: hostid
parameters.description: destination Host ID to deploy the VM to - parameter available for root admin only

parameters.name: securitygroupids
parameters.description: comma separated list of security groups id that going to be applied to the virtual machine. Should be passed only when vm is created from a zone with Basic Network support. Mutually exclusive with securitygroupnames parameter

parameters.name: securitygroupnames
parameters.description: comma separated list of security groups names that going to be applied to the virtual machine. Should be passed only when vm is created from a zone with Basic Network support. Mutually exclusive with securitygroupids parameter

parameters.name: iptonetworklist
parameters.description: ip to network mapping. Can't be specified with networkIds parameter. Example: iptonetworklist[0].ip=10.10.10.11&iptonetworklist[0].ipv6=fc00:1234:5678::abcd&iptonetworklist[0].networkid=uuid&iptonetworklist[0].mac=aa:bb:cc:dd:ee::ff - requests to use ip 10.10.10.11 in network id=uuid

parameters.name: ipaddress
parameters.description: the ip address for default vm's network

parameters.name: ip6address
parameters.description: the ipv6 address for default vm's network

parameters.name: macaddress
parameters.description: the mac address for default vm's network

parameters.name: keyboard
parameters.description: an optional keyboard device type for the virtual machine. valid value can be one of de,de-ch,es,fi,fr,fr-be,fr-ch,is,it,jp,nl-be,no,pt,uk,us

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: Deploy vm for the project

parameters.name: startvm
parameters.description: true if start vm after creating; defaulted to true if not specified

parameters.name: affinitygroupids
parameters.description: comma separated list of affinity groups id that are going to be applied to the virtual machine. Mutually exclusive with affinitygroupnames parameter

parameters.name: affinitygroupnames
parameters.description: comma separated list of affinity groups names that are going to be applied to the virtual machine.Mutually exclusive with affinitygroupids parameter

parameters.name: displayvm
parameters.description: an optional field, whether to the display the vm to the end user or not.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: used to specify the custom parameters. 'extraconfig' is not allowed to be passed in details

parameters.name: deploymentplanner
parameters.description: Deployment planner to use for vm allocation. Available to ROOT admin only

parameters.name: dhcpoptionsnetworklist
parameters.description: DHCP options which are passed to the VM on start up Example: dhcpoptionsnetworklist[0].dhcp:114=url&dhcpoptionsetworklist[0].networkid=networkid&dhcpoptionsetworklist[0].dhcp:66=www.test.com

parameters.name: datadiskofferinglist
parameters.description: datadisk template to disk-offering mapping; an optional parameter used to create additional data disks from datadisk templates; can't be specified with diskOfferingId parameter

parameters.name: extraconfig
parameters.description: an optional URL encoded string that can be passed to the virtual machine upon successful deployment

parameters.name: copyimagetags
parameters.description: if true the image tags (if any) will be copied to the VM, default value is false

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: used to specify the vApp properties.

parameters.name: nicnetworklist
parameters.description: VMware only: used to specify network mapping of a vApp VMware template registered "as-is". Example nicnetworklist[0].ip=Nic-101&nicnetworklist[0].network=uuid

parameters.name: dynamicscalingenabled
parameters.description: true if virtual machine needs to be dynamically scalable

parameters.name: overridediskofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the disk offering for the virtual machine to be used for root volume instead of the disk offering mapped in service offering.In case of virtual machine deploying from ISO, then the diskofferingid specified for root volume is ignored and uses this override disk offering id

parameters.name: iothreadsenabled
parameters.description: IOThreads are dedicated event loop threads for supported disk devices to perform block I/O requests in order to improve scalability especially on an SMP host/guest with many LUNs.

parameters.name: iodriverpolicy
parameters.description: Controls specific policies on IO

parameters.name: nicmultiqueuenumber
parameters.description: The number of queues for multiqueue NICs.

parameters.name: nicpackedvirtqueuesenabled
parameters.description: Enable packed virtqueues or not.

parameters.name: customid
parameters.description: an optional field, in case you want to set a custom id to the resource. Allowed to Root Admins only
