org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.user.v.description: Resets the password for virtual machine. The virtual machine must be in a "Stopped" state and the template must already support this feature for this command to take effect. [async]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the virtual machine

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The new password of the virtual machine. If null, a random password will be generated for the VM.

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.user.v.description: Resets the UserData for virtual machine. The virtual machine must be in a "Stopped" state.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the virtual machine

parameters.name: userdata
parameters.description: an optional binary data that can be sent to the virtual machine upon a successful deployment. This binary data must be base64 encoded before adding it to the request. Using HTTP GET (via querystring), you can send up to 4KB of data after base64 encoding. Using HTTP POST (via POST body), you can send up to 1MB of data after base64 encoding. You also need to change vm.userdata.max.length value

parameters.name: userdataid
parameters.description: the ID of the userdata

parameters.name: userdatadetails
parameters.description: used to specify the parameters values for the variables in userdata.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: an optional account for the virtual machine. Must be used with domainId.

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: an optional domainId for the virtual machine. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: an optional project for the virtual machine

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of VM schedule

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Name of the schedule

parameters.name: schedule
parameters.description: Schedule for action on VM in cron format. e.g. '0 15 10 * *' for 'at 15:00 on 10th day of every month'

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: Specifies a timezone for this command. For more information on the timezone parameter, see TimeZone Format.

parameters.name: startdate
parameters.description: start date from which the schedule becomes activeUse format "yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss")

parameters.name: enddate
parameters.description: end date after which the schedule becomes inactiveUse format "yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss")

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Enable VM schedule

parameters.name: virtualmachineid
parameters.description: ID of the VM for which schedule is to be defined

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of VM schedule

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Action taken by schedule

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: ID of VM schedule

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: List by keyword

parameters.name: nicid
parameters.description: the ID of the nic to which you want to assign private IP

parameters.name: ipaddress
parameters.description: Secondary IP Address

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the virtual machine

parameters.name: podid
parameters.description: destination Pod ID to deploy the VM to - parameter available for root admin only

parameters.name: clusterid
parameters.description: destination Cluster ID to deploy the VM to - parameter available for root admin only

parameters.name: hostid
parameters.description: destination Host ID to deploy the VM to - parameter available for root admin only

parameters.name: considerlasthost
parameters.description: True by default, CloudStack will firstly try to start the VM on the last host where it run on before stopping, if destination host is not specified. If false, CloudStack will not consider the last host and start the VM by normal process.

parameters.name: deploymentplanner
parameters.description: Deployment planner to use for vm allocation. Available to ROOT admin only

parameters.name: bootintosetup
parameters.description: Boot into hardware setup menu or not

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.user.v.description: Restore a VM to original template/ISO or new template/ISO

parameters.name: virtualmachineid
parameters.description: Virtual Machine ID

parameters.name: templateid
parameters.description: an optional template Id to restore vm from the new template. This can be an ISO id in case of restore vm deployed using ISO

parameters.name: diskofferingid
parameters.description: Override root volume's diskoffering.

parameters.name: rootdisksize
parameters.description: Override root volume's size (in GB). Analogous to details[0].rootdisksize, which takes precedence over this parameter if both are provided

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: used to specify the custom parameters

parameters.name: expunge
parameters.description: Optional field to expunge old root volume after restore.

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.user.v.description: Scales the virtual machine to a new service offering. This command also considers the volume size in the service offering or disk offering linked to the new service offering and apply all characteristics to the root volume.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the virtual machine

parameters.name: serviceofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the service offering for the virtual machine

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: name value pairs of custom parameters for cpuspeed, memory and cpunumber. example details[i].name=value

parameters.name: miniops
parameters.description: New minimum number of IOPS for the custom disk offering

parameters.name: maxiops
parameters.description: New maximum number of IOPS for the custom disk offering

parameters.name: automigrate
parameters.description: Flag for automatic migration of the root volume with new compute offering whenever migration is required to apply the offering

parameters.name: shrinkok
parameters.description: Verify OK to Shrink

org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.user.v.description: Creates and automatically starts a VNF appliance based on a service offering, disk offering, and template.

parameters.name: vnfconfiguremanagement
parameters.description: True by default, security group or network rules (source nat and firewall rules) will be configured for VNF management interfaces. False otherwise. Network rules are configured if management network is an isolated network or shared network with security groups.

parameters.name: vnfcidrlist
parameters.description: the CIDR list to forward traffic from to the VNF management interface. Multiple entries must be separated by a single comma character (,). The default value is 0.0.0.0/0.

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: availability zone for the virtual machine

parameters.name: serviceofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the service offering for the virtual machine

parameters.name: templateid
parameters.description: the ID of the template for the virtual machine

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: host name for the virtual machine

parameters.name: displayname
parameters.description: an optional user generated name for the virtual machine

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password of the virtual machine. If null, a random password will be generated for the VM.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: an optional account for the virtual machine. Must be used with domainId.

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: an optional domainId for the virtual machine. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used. If account is NOT provided then virtual machine will be assigned to the caller account and domain.

parameters.name: networkids
parameters.description: list of network ids used by virtual machine. Can't be specified with ipToNetworkList parameter

parameters.name: boottype
parameters.description: Guest VM Boot option either custom[UEFI] or default boot [BIOS]. Not applicable with VMware if the template is marked as deploy-as-is, as we honour what is defined in the template.

parameters.name: bootmode
parameters.description: Boot Mode [Legacy] or [Secure] Applicable when Boot Type Selected is UEFI, otherwise Legacy only for BIOS. Not applicable with VMware if the template is marked as deploy-as-is, as we honour what is defined in the template.

parameters.name: bootintosetup
parameters.description: Boot into hardware setup or not (ignored if startVm = false, only valid for vmware)

parameters.name: diskofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the disk offering for the virtual machine. If the template is of ISO format, the diskOfferingId is for the root disk volume. Otherwise this parameter is used to indicate the offering for the data disk volume. If the templateId parameter passed is from a Template object, the diskOfferingId refers to a DATA Disk Volume created. If the templateId parameter passed is from an ISO object, the diskOfferingId refers to a ROOT Disk Volume created.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: the arbitrary size for the DATADISK volume. Mutually exclusive with diskOfferingId

parameters.name: rootdisksize
parameters.description: Optional field to resize root disk on deploy. Value is in GB. Only applies to template-based deployments. Analogous to details[0].rootdisksize, which takes precedence over this parameter if both are provided

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: an optional group for the virtual machine

parameters.name: hypervisor
parameters.description: the hypervisor on which to deploy the virtual machine. The parameter is required and respected only when hypervisor info is not set on the ISO/Template passed to the call

parameters.name: userdata
parameters.description: an optional binary data that can be sent to the virtual machine upon a successful deployment. This binary data must be base64 encoded before adding it to the request. Using HTTP GET (via querystring), you can send up to 4KB of data after base64 encoding. Using HTTP POST (via POST body), you can send up to 1MB of data after base64 encoding. You also need to change vm.userdata.max.length value

parameters.name: userdataid
parameters.description: the ID of the Userdata

parameters.name: userdatadetails
parameters.description: used to specify the parameters values for the variables in userdata.

parameters.name: keypair
parameters.description: name of the ssh key pair used to login to the virtual machine

parameters.name: keypairs
parameters.description: names of the ssh key pairs used to login to the virtual machine

parameters.name: hostid
parameters.description: destination Host ID to deploy the VM to - parameter available for root admin only

parameters.name: securitygroupids
parameters.description: comma separated list of security groups id that going to be applied to the virtual machine. Should be passed only when vm is created from a zone with Basic Network support. Mutually exclusive with securitygroupnames parameter

parameters.name: securitygroupnames
parameters.description: comma separated list of security groups names that going to be applied to the virtual machine. Should be passed only when vm is created from a zone with Basic Network support. Mutually exclusive with securitygroupids parameter

parameters.name: iptonetworklist
parameters.description: ip to network mapping. Can't be specified with networkIds parameter. Example: iptonetworklist[0].ip=10.10.10.11&iptonetworklist[0].ipv6=fc00:1234:5678::abcd&iptonetworklist[0].networkid=uuid&iptonetworklist[0].mac=aa:bb:cc:dd:ee::ff - requests to use ip 10.10.10.11 in network id=uuid

parameters.name: ipaddress
parameters.description: the ip address for default vm's network

parameters.name: ip6address
parameters.description: the ipv6 address for default vm's network

parameters.name: macaddress
parameters.description: the mac address for default vm's network

parameters.name: keyboard
parameters.description: an optional keyboard device type for the virtual machine. valid value can be one of de,de-ch,es,fi,fr,fr-be,fr-ch,is,it,jp,nl-be,no,pt,uk,us

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: Deploy vm for the project

parameters.name: startvm
parameters.description: true if start vm after creating; defaulted to true if not specified

parameters.name: affinitygroupids
parameters.description: comma separated list of affinity groups id that are going to be applied to the virtual machine. Mutually exclusive with affinitygroupnames parameter

parameters.name: affinitygroupnames
parameters.description: comma separated list of affinity groups names that are going to be applied to the virtual machine.Mutually exclusive with affinitygroupids parameter

parameters.name: displayvm
parameters.description: an optional field, whether to the display the vm to the end user or not.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: used to specify the custom parameters. 'extraconfig' is not allowed to be passed in details

parameters.name: deploymentplanner
parameters.description: Deployment planner to use for vm allocation. Available to ROOT admin only

parameters.name: dhcpoptionsnetworklist
parameters.description: DHCP options which are passed to the VM on start up Example: dhcpoptionsnetworklist[0].dhcp:114=url&dhcpoptionsetworklist[0].networkid=networkid&dhcpoptionsetworklist[0].dhcp:66=www.test.com

parameters.name: datadiskofferinglist
parameters.description: datadisk template to disk-offering mapping; an optional parameter used to create additional data disks from datadisk templates; can't be specified with diskOfferingId parameter

parameters.name: extraconfig
parameters.description: an optional URL encoded string that can be passed to the virtual machine upon successful deployment

parameters.name: copyimagetags
parameters.description: if true the image tags (if any) will be copied to the VM, default value is false

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: used to specify the vApp properties.

parameters.name: nicnetworklist
parameters.description: VMware only: used to specify network mapping of a vApp VMware template registered "as-is". Example nicnetworklist[0].ip=Nic-101&nicnetworklist[0].network=uuid

parameters.name: dynamicscalingenabled
parameters.description: true if virtual machine needs to be dynamically scalable

parameters.name: overridediskofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the disk offering for the virtual machine to be used for root volume instead of the disk offering mapped in service offering.In case of virtual machine deploying from ISO, then the diskofferingid specified for root volume is ignored and uses this override disk offering id

parameters.name: iothreadsenabled
parameters.description: IOThreads are dedicated event loop threads for supported disk devices to perform block I/O requests in order to improve scalability especially on an SMP host/guest with many LUNs.

parameters.name: iodriverpolicy
parameters.description: Controls specific policies on IO

parameters.name: nicmultiqueuenumber
parameters.description: The number of queues for multiqueue NICs.

parameters.name: nicpackedvirtqueuesenabled
parameters.description: Enable packed virtqueues or not.

parameters.name: customid
parameters.description: an optional field, in case you want to set a custom id to the resource. Allowed to Root Admins only

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: List Region by region ID.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: List Region by region name.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: List by keyword

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the ID of the global load balancer rule

parameters.name: regionid
parameters.description: region ID

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: List resources by tags (key/value pairs)

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: list objects by project; if projectid=-1 lists All VMs

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: list resources by account. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

parameters.name: listall
parameters.description: If set to false, list only resources belonging to the command's caller; if set to true - list resources that the caller is authorized to see. Default value is false. Resources dedicated to a project are listed only if using the projectid parameter.

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: list only resources belonging to the domain specified

parameters.name: isrecursive
parameters.description: defaults to false, but if true, lists all resources from the parent specified by the domainId till leaves.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: List by keyword

parameters.description: Update resource limits for project

parameters.description: Maximum resource limit.

parameters.name: resourcetype
parameters.description: Type of resource to update. Values are 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10 and 11. 0 - Instance. Number of instances a user can create. 1 - IP. Number of public IP addresses a user can own. 2 - Volume. Number of disk volumes a user can create. 3 - Snapshot. Number of snapshots a user can create. 4 - Template. Number of templates that a user can register/create. 5 - Project. Number of projects a user can create. 6 - Network. Number of guest network a user can create. 7 - VPC. Number of VPC a user can create. 8 - CPU. Total number of CPU cores a user can use. 9 - Memory. Total Memory (in MB) a user can use. 10 - PrimaryStorage. Total primary storage space (in GiB) a user can use. 11 - SecondaryStorage. Total secondary storage space (in GiB) a user can use.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Tag for the resource type

Number of instances a user can create. 1 - IP. Number of public IP addresses a user can own. 2 - Volume. Number of disk volumes a user can create. 3 - Snapshot. Number of snapshots a user can create. 4 - Template. Number of templates that a user can register/create. 5 - Project. Number of projects that a user can create. 6 - Network. Number of guest network a user can create. 7 - VPC. Number of VPC a user can create. 8 - CPU. Total number of CPU cores a user can use. 9 - Memory. Total Memory (in MB) a user can use. 10 - PrimaryStorage. Total primary storage space (in GiB) a user can use. 11 - SecondaryStorage. Total secondary storage space (in GiB) a user can use.

Number of templates an account can register/create. 5 - Project. Number of projects an account can own. 6 - Network. Number of networks an account can own. 7 - VPC. org.apache.cloudstack.api.command.user.v.description: Attaches a disk volume to a virtual machine.

parameters.name: deviceid
parameters.description:
The ID of the device to map the volume to the guest OS. If no deviceID is informed, the next available deviceID will be chosen. Use 0 when volume needs to be attached as ROOT.
When using a linux operating system and the hypervisor XenServer, the devices IDs will be mapped as follows:
  • 0 maps to /dev/xvda;
  • 1 maps to /dev/xvdb;
  • 2 maps /dev/xvdc and so on.
Please refer to the docs of your hypervisor for the correct mapping of the deviceID and the actual logical disk structure.

parameters.description: Flag to allow automatic migration of the volume to another suitable storage pool that accommodates the new size
